title: Capacitor - electric field using charge density

content.question: The plates of a parallel-plate capacitor are separated by <math alttext="0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Each plate is a square of area <math alttext="0.16 meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and has a surface charge density of magnitude <math alttext="5.0 times 10 raised to the negative 8 power, coulomb per meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>C/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Which of the following is most nearly the magnitude of the electric field between the plates of the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="1100 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>
<math alttext="5600 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5600 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
